topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XV, Central America
topic.body: This volume is part of a Foreign Relations subseries that documents the most important foreign policy issues of the Jimmy Carter administration. The volume documents the Carter administration's response to events in Central America that tested its policy of stressing human rights and non-intervention in Latin America.
topic.image-description: Book Cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XV, Central America
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
